step1.sentence: Long story short, I missed the train and had to take a cab to the airport.

step2.story: My friend asked me how my job interview went yesterday. I took a deep breath and said, "Long story short, they offered me the position on the spot." She screamed with excitement and gave me the biggest hug.

step3.story: Last summer, I planned a simple weekend trip to the coast with two friends. We packed the car, loaded up snacks, and hit the road full of energy. About an hour in, we took a wrong turn and ended up on a dirt road leading to a tiny fishing village we'd never heard of. The locals were so welcoming that we ended up staying for three days, eating fresh seafood and sleeping in a guesthouse by the harbor. Long story short, the best vacation I ever had was the one that went completely off plan. Now we go back to that village every year.

meaning.realUsageKo: 복잡하거나 긴 사연을 생략하고 핵심 결과만 전달할 때 사용합니다. 보통 문장 앞에 붙여서 '결론만 말하자면'이라는 뉘앙스로 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 영어 관용구 'to make a long story short'에서 유래했으며, 19세기부터 널리 쓰였습니다. 긴 설명을 줄여서 요점만 전달하겠다는 화자의 의도를 나타냅니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 일상 대화에서 자연스럽게 쓰이는 캐주얼한 표현입니다. 격식 있는 자리보다는 친구나 동료와의 대화에서 주로 사용하며, 약간의 드라마틱한 효과를 줄 때도 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Long story short, we ended up moving to a completely different city.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 짧게 말하면, 우리는 결국 완전히 다른 도시로 이사하게 됐어.
